author: SakuraCombinedFleet
content: [New Year's Memories] Currently enjoying soba with Lady Mikasa and Richelieu.

comments.content: Having a piping hot bowl of soba on a cool New Years' Eve makes me feel like I'm going to live forever. This is my favorite tradition :D

replies.content: Mikasa, shall I give you a shoulder rub next time?
Oh, Nagato? There's no need to go out your way for me, young one.

comments.content: Is this the photo from that last time? The Sakura Empire's soba is truly delicious, but learning how to use chopsticks was no easy feat.

replies.content: I am glad you came. We should have more events to strengthen the bonds between our peoples.
However, more impressive is your ability to learn new things, Lady Richelieu.
Ahhh, now I want to eat ramen!
Shall I make some for you, Nagato?
Is she talking to herself...???
Ahaha looks like I'll have to explain a thing or two first!
I see... there are three people on her account... Thank you for your explanation over DM, Mikasa.

comments.content: How wonderful this peace is...

replies.content: Yes, and it's only possible because of you, Commamder.

comments.content: Uhh... New Years was 9 months ago...

replies.content: It took me a while to figure out how to upload... :)

author: HMS Neptune
content: I have discovered the splendid flavours of Sakura ice cream! My dear friends from the Sakura Empire, recipe please!

comments.content: Ah! Discerning taste you have there~! If you want to know how to make it... Perhaps Hiei can give you some insight?

replies.content: Haha, want to watch us the next time we make it, Miss Neptune?
Whoa! Sounds lovely! What time?

comments.content: Yaaaaay! let's bring Bel along and study up! (*^▽^*)

replies.content: Hm? Would you like to learn how to make your own ice cream?
It'd be so much better if you made it! I'd be glad to taste test...
Hehe, very well. Let's set a time and all head down together.

comments.content: Sakura Empire... ice cream?

replies.content: Yes! Good stuff, isn't it?

comments.content: Did someone say Neptune ice cream? Shut up and take my money!

replies.content: Hehe, sure~ But how much are you willing to pay, Commander? It doesn't come cheap~

author: Shangri-La
content: Essex is currently concentrating on grilling beef tongue.

comments.content: Haha, Essex is always such an industrious young lady.

replies.content: "I've already done my research! Just a bit longer... Beef tongue must be grilled to perfection before it is optimal for consumption..." So she says.

comments.content: Umm... can I eat already?
Barbecue Boss?! Grill General?! Meat Maestro?!
Is she facing down a Siren?!

replies.content: "Grilling meat IS a battle!" said Essex.

author: Shangri-La
content: The ravenous Enterprise took the initiative, breaking Essex's focus.

comments.content: AAAAAAAA NOOOOOOO! TOO SOON, ENTERPRISE! TOO SOON!

replies.content: Oh, sorry. It looked done to me and I was really hungry...
Well, it WAS cooked... but it hadn't reached the pinnacle of deliciousness!

comments.content: Essex is going to remember that one, Enty.

replies.content: I'm real sorry, Essex. I'll cook the next plate to make up for it.
I couldn't possibly make you go out of your way like that! Let me handle the cooking, so just sit back and enjoy the meal!
Well... all right. Discretion is the better part of valor...
Essex won't ever back down on matters of principle. How very much like her.

comments.content: Remind me never to get on her bad side.

replies.content: Wait for it... wait for it...

comments.content: Huh, I guess grilling meat really is an art.

replies.content: It's a bit of a science as well! And yet, you wouldn't believe how few people take it seriously.

author: Lucky Lou
content: What a dangerously delicious scent...

comments.content: Dangerous? Umm, Cleveland, is that pufferfish?

replies.content: Hahaha, I didn't actually try to eat it, just thought it'd be fun to post :D
Oh, thank goodness. I know you like trying new things, but there's a fine line between bravery and recklessness.
Even I have my limits ^^
Pufferish sashimi is delicious! It's even better when you dip it in the sauce!

comments.content: Ah, fugu, as we call it. Delicious as it may be, proper handling and preparation is crucial. Do be careful when you eat it.

replies.content: Yeah, that's why I said I was just posting this for fun! Not like I tried it or plan on eating it lol
Probably a wise decision...

comments.content: Right, some parts are poisonous after all.

replies.content: It's nevertheless worth a try, wouldn't you agree, Commander?

comments.content: Cleveland... you're not *actually* gonna eat that raw, are you?

replies.content: Seriously, it's just for fun!

author: Ran_mew
content: Why waste time on such flashy, transient activities?

comments.content: Awww, don't be like that, Kaga. Even we need a little recreation from time to time. Besides, aren't you having fun?

replies.content: Fun? Nonsense...
That's not what your mask is saying.
You're wagging your tails too lmao
Hiryuu, please show due respect to Kaga...
Ugh, fine

comments.content: Kaga, celebrations and fireworks are not meaningless at all!

replies.content: Now now, Zuikaku, there's no need to judge how others enjoy themselves~
Is that so...?

comments.content: Seems like you're having a nice time.

replies.content: ...Not really.

comments.content: Hey, if nothing else, your mask is cute.

replies.content: ...Really? Thanks... I guess.

author: forMaster_Sirius
content: The Royal Maids tried to make Sakura-style gyoza. They were quite delicious, but the garlic...

comments.content: Hm? Was there something amiss?

replies.content: The garlic's stench... Ahh, my honourable Master, please punish this befouled maid!
Haha... Should I go make some mint tea?
You said it was delicious, right? Then what's the problem?

comments.content: Have a pint of ale, and the weird aftertaste will be gone in no time!

replies.content: Hah! Bold solutions for bold individuals.
Perhaps... drinking myself to oblivion wouldn't be a bad idea either...
Please don't...

comments.content: Looks delicious to me.

replies.content: In that case, I shall bring some to you this instant, my honourable Master!

comments.content: I don't mind one bit. I'm a big fan of garlic.

replies.content: Ah, thank you, my honourable Master...

author: Justice_B
content: Today's lunch is... not your usual burger!

comments.content: woah, that looks legit! where'd u get it?

replies.content: I'll send the address to you.
woah, those are some rave reviews~ next time, let's grab the girls and DO THIS!

comments.content: Nya? Akashi smells something good! The scent of OPPORTUNITY! Let's hold a Sasebo Burger Festival right here, nya!

replies.content: Wait, what?
woah, the nostalgia! I want a pork belly burger, NOW!
Oh right. I just remembered you're from Sasebo.

comments.content: No matter where you are, anyone can appreciate a good burger.

replies.content: Well yeah, because they're delicious! One day they might bring world peace, even!

comments.content: Is this any different from a regular burger?

replies.content: Umm, it's got more style than most ordinary burgers, I guess?

author: VivaLaze
content: Who came up with the idea of going through an entire workout to get at some crab meat? It is really good though...

comments.content: Non non. You weren't even the one who shelled the crabs. Make sure to thank Dunkerque later, okay?

replies.content: That has no bearing whatsoever upon the fact that it's a pain in the butt to eat!

comments.content: Hehe~ That's why you need a shell cracker to make the job easier.

replies.content: Thank you for helping us with it. If you hadn't, we would've been at it all day...
Using a tool to dismantle the one thing keeping me from my prey, piece by piece... Ahaha, how very satisfying!
Can you talk like a normal person...?

comments.content: A pro at work.

replies.content: Ahaha... I simply did a bit of prep work beforehand~

comments.content: Hit the enemy crab in its weak spot for massive damage!

replies.content: Is that you, Long Island? Get off the computer.

author: Suzu✩
content: #OutWithTheBad #InWithTheGood

comments.content: a photo from setsubun, huh? considering how we have horns to begin with, that whole thing felt a bit lulzy

replies.content: You were having the most fun out of all of us, Kumano.
After how this year has been so far... I can only hope the next one will be better.
Cheer up, Mogami! Hasn't this been a pretty good year for us?

comments.content: Heh. It's fun throwing those beans around. Plus, the giant sushi roll was pretty tasty as well.

replies.content: I bet it was! You were chowing down on it like it was going out of fashion!
Hey, weren't you the one who said that my dreams wouldn't come true if I didn't cram it all down in one go?

comments.content: A lot of food-related traditions in the Sakura Empire, huh?

replies.content: They exist in droves wherever you go! It's just a matter of looking for them.

author: AzumaB65
content: #ReleasingSpirits May all the lost souls find peace.

comments.content: Yes. I can help with that, if you want.

replies.content: Oh, aren't you the sweetest, Ayanami? Thank you!
Is this also one of the Sakura Empire's unique traditions?
Yes... It's like a prayer. A ceremony for saying farewell.

comments.content: There are all different sorts of spirit vessels, as they're known.

replies.content: Everyone put in a lot of time and effort into making them!
Yes, we did. I did so, too.

comments.content: And so they sail off to a new world. Farewell, brave souls...

replies.content: It's beautiful in a way, yet sad in another...

author: SnowStorm
content: Fire ramen! Delicious! But burning hot! But still delicious!

comments.content: same. solid recommendation. was it really that hot though? didn't feel like it to me.

replies.content: A measly bowl of ramen is no match for Yukikaze the Great!
dunno about that, judging from your expression...

comments.content: ahaha! ur just like a little kid, yukikaze!

replies.content: Silence, fool! I simply didn't have time to adjust to the temperature of the ramen!

comments.content: then would it really kill you to wait til it's cooled down a bit? dumbass

replies.content: IT WOULDN'T BE AS GOOD THEN! PAIN IS PLEASURE!
Touché.

comments.content: So, you can't handle hot food?

replies.content: Nonsense! My mouth just needs a few minutes to adjust!

comments.content: I want ramen too...

replies.content: I suppose Yukikaze the Great could be convinced to allow you to tag along!

author: NikuSuki
content: awoo?! this is the best freakin meat EVER!!!

comments.content: geesh, slow down. I'm not saving you if you choke from trying to inhale your food.

replies.content: but its freakin good! besides, ur doing the same thing!
Am not!
Ahaha... Aren't they both so cute? Let's all get sukiyaki together next time.
helllll yeahhhh! im down for meat this good any time!

comments.content: Hmph. Not bad. A little bit of liquor to cap off the meal... Yeah, that's some good stuff right there.

replies.content: All right, we've gotta do this again! Buddy up, we'll meet back here in a couple days!
Such exquisite beef... But isn't this method a bit wasteful?
way tooo goooood!

comments.content: Share.

replies.content: should i save some for you next time?

comments.content: You must be pretty happy if you're offering.

replies.content: yep! nothing makes me happier than having delicious meat in my belly!

author: OutrangeTH
content: #AwaOdori My Commander, please enjoy my dance~♥

comments.content: Woahhh, is this a special Sakura Empire dance? Looks like a lot of fun!

replies.content: Y-you again?! What do you want?!
Let's play together! I wanna learn that dance too!
NO. BEGONE.

comments.content: Oh my. There's no harm in that, is there? Not all dances must be for the gods, as there is joy to be had simply through the art itself.

replies.content: Let's all dance together! I'm getting excited just thinking about it~
My plan to draw my Commander's full, undivided attention...

comments.content: What a fiery dance!

replies.content: Yes, my Commander! For you, I would dance until I go up into flames, should you will it~

comments.content: Stunning! If only I could see it in person!

replies.content: Gladly, my Commander! Afterwards, I can offer you a different type of dance, if you wish~♥

author: Mikasa
content: Noooooooooooo! I failed to flip the okonomiyaki again :(

comments.content: Don't worry. Just be more careful, and you'll be sure to succeed next time~

replies.content: Thank you for your kind words,,,
Well, it doesn't seem to have affected the taste. It's still delicious, I'd say.

comments.content: Ohhhhh! I totally understand, Lady Mikasa! I too know the bitter defeat of failing the flip...

replies.content: I've disgraced myself before those who look up to me. How shameful... :(
Next time, let's practice the art of okonomiyaki flipping, together!
I suppose I'll foot the bill for both of you next time? Hehe~

comments.content: You two, it's not that big of a deal.

replies.content: I have been derelict in my training lol

comments.content: Shall I do it for you next time?

replies.content: I won't fail again :)

author: Honolulu
content: Ugh... octopus >_>

comments.content: What's the matter, Honolulu? Not going to eat?

replies.content: I'd rather not... just looking at it brings back unwanted memories...

comments.content: Oh, are you talking about what happened that one time? If I remember properly...

replies.content: NO NEED TO REMIND ME THANKS T_T UGHHHH
I see... St. Louis just explained it to me. I'm sorry to hear it, Honolulu.
You should consider that as your great comeback.
I don't feel like I "won" at all!

comments.content: That reminds me...

replies.content: UGGGHHHH STOP IT

comments.content: Let's be fair here, octopus is pretty tasty.

replies.content: maybe... when it's not trying to make *you* into its next meal...

author: Victorious
content: Behold, chestnut confections!

comments.content: Are these the sweets the girl from the Sakura Empire mentioned at the last tea party?

replies.content: That's right! I bought some for you, so I hope you attend the next tea party as well!
My~ I'm looking forward to it♪

comments.content: That's called kurikinton! Where'd you buy them?

replies.content: Oh, you don't know the store? I presumed everyone from the Sakura Empire would've heard about it... I DM'd you the details.
Yeah, I saw! Man, I really want to go there with Hatsuharu as soon as possible!

comments.content: Some kurikinton would really hit the spot right about now.

replies.content: I expected you to say that, so I bought extra just in case! I'll bring some over to the office later.

comments.content: If only I had some right now! The craving's driving me nuts!

replies.content: "Then maybe you should've come with me, hehe~

author: VV_Littorio
content: Mmh. Fine wine under the moonlight. If only I had someone to share it with.

comments.content: That's an elegant facet of Eastern culture, isn't it?

replies.content: That might be true, but the moon pales in comparison to the beauty of a signora such as you.
Oh my, I'll gladly accept that compliment~

comments.content: Oh, Miss Littorio. You were out drinking over there? I was worried senseless!

replies.content: Yes, just on a whim. Apologies for making you worry... Shall we have a drink together, as my way of making up for it?
I-I really can't right now! But thanks for the suggestion. It seems the night winds are pretty strong, so please take care of yourself!
I am Littorio, I'll be fine. I'm heading back soon anyway.

comments.content: Definitely the sort of activity you do together with someone.

replies.content: Well, Commander? How about joining me for some snacks and a drink under the serene moon?

comments.content: You know what they say... "The moon really is beautiful today."

replies.content: Are you trying to hit on me? Hehehe!"

author: Champagne
content: Our beliefs are different... However, this place is solemn and sacred. A sanctuary that must not be defiled.

comments.content: Are you on a trip, Champagne?

replies.content: Though spreading the Lord's teachings is the duty of apostles, broadening the breadth of one's experiences is the way of Man.
I-I guess that's true! I want to go see the world as well!
As person, not ship, no shackles remain — none binding thy feet, stopping thee from going forth.

comments.content: Our beliefs are different, but just as our Lord does, he guides men to the path of good, just the same.

replies.content: If all things exist for the same reason, aim to coexist, so that they may be saved as well.

comments.content: What a grand statue of the Buddha!

replies.content: Through time's harsh passage, this dignified sanctuary loseth not its glory.

author: Formidable
content: Nothing is better than Sakura Empire tea for calming the nerves, I find.

comments.content: My, is that so? I would love to try another nation's tea for a change.

replies.content: The taste is quite different from the black tea that we in the Royal Navy drink.
You've piqued my interest~ Won't you prepare some for me at the next tea party?
There's nothing I can't do, but... I'll think about it!

comments.content: Did someone from the Sakura Empire make it for you?

replies.content: Yes, I was treated to some when I was invited to tea by Kongou.
That's nice. I wonder if I can join you all next time.
If that's what Miss Victorious desires, then by all means, please join us next time.
Their tea preparation ceremony seemed like a lot of needless extra work... Or should I say, "seemed like it took a lot of planning."

comments.content: Don't try to rush it. Enjoy the wabi-sabi for what it is.

replies.content: Yes, I do plan on enjoying it slowly. Hehehe.

author: viersech
content: A festival of which I never knew before... I had fun, that much I will say.

comments.content: Abandoning oneself to nocturnal passions while hidden in the dark of the night, hmm?

replies.content: My compatriot, did you not enjoy yourself?
I wouldn't say that. Seeing my brethren have fun brought joy to my soul, too.

comments.content: So this is the Sakura Empire's "Nebuta Festival." It seems like you had a wild time!

replies.content: The jostling crowd and the marvelous flashing display made me flush with excitement!
hey Ayanami, let's go see it together sometime! (^o^)丿
Yes, let's. I'll go invite some other girls too.

comments.content: What's the wishing slip say? "Sound Health"?

replies.content: Yep. I offered a prayer for you, for my compatriots, and for all that stand near and dear to me.

comments.content: I'm glad that you enjoyed it.

replies.content: Thank you. Let us chant together: rasse-ra! Rasse-ra!

author: GRAFSPEE
content: We got together and made this imoni stew. It was good.

comments.content: When enjoying tasty food with friends, you gotta have alcohol. The sake I got from the Sakura Empire was just amazing~

replies.content: Listen, Eugen! Don't you ever pick a drunk quarrel with Spee ever again!
Hahaha~ Don't say that. Didn't Spee have fun too?
Well... I was a bit surprised, but that was my first time seeing that side of you. I guess that makes me happy?
...Hmph! I'm only letting you off this time!

comments.content: Leave the drunkards to themselves. What are you doing? Just enjoy your food.

replies.content: But Hipper, you ended up carrying Eugen all the way back to the dorms on your back...
My sister wears her feelings on her sleeves, don't you know? Hehehe~
Excuse me?! Since when do I do that?!
Do you not...?
Oh, for god's sake! Just stop talking about it already!

comments.content: Great, I'd say. That's a stew I could have every day.

replies.content: Yeah, you're right. You're a precious comrade too, Commander.

author: Dido_Doll
content: I'm... at my limit already...

comments.content: Is that... the wanko soba challenge?!

replies.content: They brought more out... I guess I need to finish it...
Is that the competition where you're supposed to eat as much as you can in the alloted time?

comments.content: Oh, if you cover up your bowl, you're saying "I give up!" so you can stop whenever you'd like.

replies.content: All this time, that was an option?!
Wanko soba is supposed to be enjoyed without forcing yourself, so there's no reason to get anxious over it.
Well, I learned something new today...

comments.content: Good lord! You okay there, Dido?

replies.content: To have made Master worry over me... I'm such a useless maid...

author: Bremerton
content: Food selfie! Check it out: the hottest new ice cream on the block!

comments.content: I know we ate the same thing, but did it actually look like that?

replies.content: Tsk tsk, my friend. Snapping a good pic is only half the battle, applying the right filters is the other!
All I care about is if it's tasty or not tho, lol.

comments.content: Hey, how about some pictures of food that aid in stamina training, and not just a nonstop stream of sweets and junk food?

replies.content: Yeah, sure, next time. Seriously though, give this ice cream a try next time! You'll love it!
I'll consider it.
I'll let you know where it is later!

comments.content: It's almost too pretty to eat!

replies.content: Yeah well, either you eat it, or it melts and goes to waste!

comments.content: If your ice cream is hot, something's gone very wrong.

replies.content: Lmao, you got me there. Genuinely though, 10/10 ice cream, I recommend it!

author: Cleveland☆Knight
content: Tonight, our hero Reno takes on monstrous villains from a strange land!

comments.content: You took a picture of that? Ahaha... When I saw that little girl looking scared, I couldn't help but dash out in front of her...

replies.content: That's because you're a gallant hero, Reno.
Yeah! You're so cool you deserve an origin story movie! :D
Looking back at it, it's a bit embarrassing, but thanks for taking the picture, Cleveland!

comments.content: Those "namahage" might look scary, but they're servants of the gods who punish bad children and bring happiness to families... Or so the legends say.

replies.content: Is that so?! I had always thought they were some sort of movie villain...
It's perfectly fine~ If anything, thanks for protecting Fumizuki. She's been talking about "her hero, Reno" ever since~

comments.content: Reno, to the rescuuueee!

replies.content: Being called that by the person I admire... It's so embarassing >.<

author: S.Louis
content: Fish on rice... the expert craftsmanship of a chef who's honed his technique... I see. As expected of the culture of the respected Sakura Empire.

comments.content: Even if one lacks technique, if one puts their all into making sushi, their feelings will be conveyed... Or so I've heard, at least.

replies.content: Which is to say, a chef expresses themselves through their cooking?

comments.content: Also, what was it called... the wasabi? It gave me an unforgettable shock.

replies.content: It's just as you say, Cardinal. For those of us in the service of Lord Iris who are used to bland food, it definitely would...
Bound to shock people who aren't used to it, that's for sure.
However, there's no doubt that even that was refined over a long period of time. Eating fish with soy sauce and wasabi. I consume all of it with the respect it's due.

comments.content: If you're a first-timer, you should have it without the wasabi.

replies.content: Thank you for the suggestion. But we've already experienced the shocking flavor.

author: P.P.O
content: I tried the famous curry♪

comments.content: A battleship on curry? Can you eat that battleship as well?

replies.content: Nope, you can't. It's just for show, sadly.

comments.content: Is this the famed naval curry?

replies.content: I dunno, it tastes a little different from the naval curry our port has.

comments.content: The weather appears to be perfect for curry.

replies.content: Sure is! Cloudless days like these always put me in the mood for curry.

comments.content: Compared to our naval curry, which one tastes better?

replies.content: Hard to say. Both are good in their own way!

comments.content: Out shopping, eh?

replies.content: Yep, along with Passepartout!

author: Proj23.Ros
content: Today, I learned that you're not supposed to double dip.

comments.content: Yup, that's because the sauce is for everyone to use.

replies.content: Sigh, I can't believe I committed such a faux pas when I was the one invited there.
Was your first time, so don't worry about it too much.
Sorry for being so clueless. But now that I know, I'll make sure to follow the rules.

comments.content: Hm? Is double dipping bad?

replies.content: Uh-huh, it is. For sanitary reasons, double dipping is usually banned~

comments.content: There are shops that let you double dip though.

replies.content: Really... What a wide world this is...

comments.content: The skewers are really good too.

replies.content: Yep, I really enjoyed them.

author: Nshiro
content: Summer kiritanpo. Ah, what a treat.

comments.content: Hah, look at the doggie in the back. I can imagine the "GIMME MEAT!" so vividly

replies.content: Everyone loves meat, but don't forget to eat your vegetables.
Says the girl who didn't put any veggies on her plate!
What can I say? I'm a meat lover. Besides, it's kiritanpo, what's the big deal?

comments.content: It sure is fun having hotpot with everyone like this.

replies.content: Yes, we must all be thankful to Noshiro for bringing us together~
All I did was get everyone together. The delicious food, that's thanks to you.
No no, it's enough that you set the plan in motion. Make sure to invite us all again?

comments.content: Kiritanpo hotpot sure is popular even in the summer.

replies.content: That's right. Commander, would you like to join us next time?
If the Commander comes, what ingredients should we prepare? You know, for the taste and stuff.
...How about fish...?
